abstract: A type that specifies the URL template for a tile overlay.
overview:
## Discussion

You may set the URL template as either a template string or a function.

The template string must be in the format: `https://myserver/tile?x={x}&y={y}&z={z}&scale={scale}`. MapKit JS replaces the `x`, `y`, `z`, and `scale` values depending on the displayed map region and screen resolution, then loads an image from that URL. You can also add custom values to the template string. For example, a template string could look like: `https://{subdomain}.customtileserver.com/{z}/{x}/{y}?lang={lang}`. In this case, you must define `TileOverlay.data.subdomain` and `TileOverlay.data.lang` for the placeholders to populate. Also, note that not all parameters are necessary in a template string. The `scale` parameter is absent in this example.

You can provide a callback function instead of the template string. When MapKit JS needs to request new tiles, it invokes the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/TileOverlay/urlTemplate] callback with the parameters `x`, `y`, `z`, `scale`, and `data`. The callback function must return a URL for the provided parameters. If the return value is anything but a nonempty string, MapKit JS doesn’t load any tiles for the requested region.

# TileOverlayUrlTemplate

**Type**

A type that specifies the URL template for a tile overlay.

## Declaration

```swift
type TileOverlayUrlTemplate =
    | string
    | ((x: number, y: number, z: number, scale: number, data: any) => string);
```

## Discussion

You may set the URL template as either a template string or a function.

The template string must be in the format: `https://myserver/tile?x={x}&y={y}&z={z}&scale={scale}`. MapKit JS replaces the `x`, `y`, `z`, and `scale` values depending on the displayed map region and screen resolution, then loads an image from that URL. You can also add custom values to the template string. For example, a template string could look like: `https://{subdomain}.customtileserver.com/{z}/{x}/{y}?lang={lang}`. In this case, you must define `TileOverlay.data.subdomain` and `TileOverlay.data.lang` for the placeholders to populate. Also, note that not all parameters are necessary in a template string. The `scale` parameter is absent in this example.

You can provide a callback function instead of the template string. When MapKit JS needs to request new tiles, it invokes the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/TileOverlay/urlTemplate] callback with the parameters `x`, `y`, `z`, `scale`, and `data`. The callback function must return a URL for the provided parameters. If the return value is anything but a nonempty string, MapKit JS doesn’t load any tiles for the requested region.

## Overlays

- **Adding interactivity to overlays**: Configure and respond to overlays to make them interactive.
- **Overlay**: An abstract base object that defines the methods and properties for map overlays.
- **Style**: A set of observable style properties for overlays, including the color and opacity of strokes and fills, and line styles.
- **CircleOverlay**: A circular overlay with a configurable radius that centers on a specific geographic coordinate.
- **PolylineOverlay**: An overlay of connected line segments that don’t form a closed shape.
- **PolygonOverlay**: An overlay consisting of one or more points that forms a closed shape.
- **OverlayOptions**: A dictionary of options that determines an overlay’s data, and indicates whether it’s visible, in an enabled state, and in a selected state.
- **TileOverlay**: An overlay that covers an area of the map with bitmapped tiles.
